headline: Exiger Becomes Lead Partner of U.S. Navy Athletics
summary: Exiger, the market-leading supply chain AI company and largest provider of supply chain technology to the U.S. Federal Government, today announced its sponsorship of Navy Athletics alongside fellow defense leaders like Boeing, HII, Lockheed Martin, MANTECH, and Northrop Grumman. As a Lead Partner, Exiger will sponsor athletic events throughout the year and support the Naval Academy Athletic Association's work to promote the athletic contests of the midshipmen of the United States Naval Academy.

raw.headline: Exiger Becomes Lead Partner of U.S. Navy Athletics
raw.summary: Exiger, the market-leading supply chain AI company and largest provider of supply chain technology to the U.S. Federal Government, today announced its sponsorship of Navy Athletics alongside fellow defense leaders like Boeing, HII, Lockheed Martin, MANTECH, and Northrop Grumman. As a Lead Partner, Exiger will sponsor athletic events throughout the year and support the Naval Academy Athletic Association's work to promote the athletic contests of the midshipmen of the United States Naval Academy.

headline: Lockheed Martin Just Raised Its Dividend by 5%. Should You Buy LMT Stock Here?
summary: Lockheed Martin’s Q3 results beat expectations with $18.6 billion in sales and record cash flow, prompting a 5% dividend increase to $3.45 per share and a $2 billion boost in buybacks—its 23rd straight annual dividend hike.

headline: What Catalysts Could Shift the Story for Lockheed Martin Amid Analyst Optimism and Sector Risks
summary: Lockheed Martin’s stock is in the spotlight this week following a revised Fair Value Estimate, which has climbed to $516.56 per share from a previous $493.71. This upward adjustment is driven by a mix of robust order activity and heightened optimism about the company’s near-term growth prospects, even as certain risks linger. Stay tuned to discover how keeping up with shifts in market outlook can help you anticipate changes in Lockheed Martin’s investment narrative. What Wall Street Has Been...
